segment.source: Package Name Page (Learn More)
segment.target: Package Name Page (Learn More)

segment.source: Package Name Page (Learn More)
segment.target: Package Name Page (Learn More)

segment.source: Package Name Page (Learn More)
segment.target: Package Name Page (Learn More)

segment.source: Use the Package Name page to specify a name for the virtual application package.
segment.target: Use the Package Name page to specify a name for the virtual application package.

segment.source: You can also configure where the package will reside on the target computers.
segment.target: You can also configure where the package will reside on the target computers.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Editing the primary virtual application directory is an advanced task.
segment.target: Editing the primary virtual application directory is an advanced task.

segment.source: This page contains the following elements:
segment.target: This page contains the following elements:

segment.source: Virtual Application Package Name
segment.target: Virtual Application Package Name

segment.source: Specifies the name that will be associated with virtual application package.
segment.target: Specifies the name that will be associated with virtual application package.

segment.source: The name specified should help identify the purpose and version of the application.
segment.target: The name specified should help identify the purpose and version of the application.

segment.source: The package name is also displayed in the App-V management console.
segment.target: The package name is also displayed in the App-V management console.

segment.source: Edit (Advanced)
segment.target: Edit (Advanced)

segment.source: Select this option to change the location of where the virtual application will be installed on target computers.
segment.target: Select this option to change the location of where the virtual application will be installed on target computers.

segment.source: Editing the Application Virtualization path is an advanced configuration task.
segment.target: Editing the Application Virtualization path is an advanced configuration task.

segment.source: You should fully understand the implications of changing the path.
segment.target: You should fully understand the implications of changing the path.

segment.source: For most applications, we recommend the default path.
segment.target: For most applications, we recommend the default path.

segment.source: Only select this option, if you prefer to generate your own file name.
segment.target: Only select this option, if you prefer to generate your own file name.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics
